summary: "Revolver" is the seventh album by the Beatles, released in 1966. It's considered one of the best and most creative albums in music history. The band used new studio tricks and sounds, like double tracking and tape loops, to make unique songs. They explored new themes like death and Eastern philosophy. The album includes hits like "Eleanor Rigby" and "Yellow Submarine." It was a big success, topping charts in the UK and US. Many critics now think it's even better than their famous "Sgt. Pepper" album.
title: Revolver (Beatles album)
